solution_line_template: At a {discount_percent_num} percent discount, Jordyn will pay {discount_percent_num}/{percent_divisor}%*${cherry_price_initial}=${cherry_discount_amount} less for a bag of cherries.

To buy one of the cherries at a 10% discount Jordyn will pay ${cherry_price_initial}-${cherry_discount_amount}=<<{cherry_price_initial}-{cherry_discount_amount}={cherry_price_discounted_per_bag}>>{cherry_price_discounted_per_bag}

The cost of buying {num_bags_each_fruit} bags of cherries at the 10% discount is {num_bags_each_fruit}*{cherry_price_discounted_per_bag}=<<{num_bags_each_fruit}*{cherry_price_discounted_per_bag}={total_cost_cherries}>>{total_cost_cherries}

Also, at a 10% discount, Jordyn will pay {discount_percent_num}/{percent_divisor}*${olive_price_initial}=<<{discount_percent_num}/{percent_divisor}*{olive_price_initial}={olive_discount_amount}>>{olive_discount_amount} less for a bag of olives.

The price of a bag of olives at a 10% discount is ${olive_price_initial}-${olive_discount_amount}=<<{olive_price_initial}-{olive_discount_amount}={olive_price_discounted_per_bag}>>{olive_price_discounted_per_bag}

To buy {num_bags_each_fruit} bags of olives Jordyn will pay ${olive_price_discounted_per_bag}*{num_bags_each_fruit}=<<{olive_price_discounted_per_bag}*{num_bags_each_fruit}={total_cost_olives}>>{total_cost_olives}
The total cost of buying 50 bags of each fruit at a 10% discount is ${total_cost_olives}+${total_cost_cherries}=${total_cost_both_fruits}
